recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Rasam is a spicy broth made with lentils or tomatoes or combination of both, tamarind and is one of the main course in south indian meal best accompanied with rice.
This tomato rasam is a quick and easy recipe made without using tamarind  provides relief to your sore throat as well.

Do you know tomatoes are a great source of Antioxidants containing lycopene. Including lycopene containing foods in your food helps for healthy bones. Women are more prone to Osteoporosis if failing to include lycopene in their daily diet. It also helps in fighting against cancerous cell formation.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Pressure cook lentils till 3 whistles. Once done, keep it aside.

In a kadai (wok), put oil. Once heated, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds. Allow it to splutter. Add red chilies, curry leaves & asafoetida and fry it for 5 -8 seconds. Be careful at this step as when curry leaves is put into hot oil, it splutters oil in all directions. So to be safer, cover atleast the kadai as soon as you add curry leaves.
Now add garlic and ginger saut√©  it for 1 min.Reduce the flame to low, add turmeric, red chili powder. Fry for 30 sec.

Now add tomato puree, fry for 10 mins. If you are using chopped tomatoes, fry till it becomes a paste. Add dal into the mixture. You can add additional water if required. Add salt. Cover the kadai and simmer till the rasam comes to boil.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve it hot with rice.

tips.tipDesc: You can also add pepper powder at the end. It soothes the throat.
